Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, lets list the expected normal flow:1. Register Order (Sales)2. Perform Credit Check (Finance)3. Validate Stock (Warehouse)4. Confirm Shipment (Logistics)5. Ship Goods (Logistics)6. Issue Invoice (Finance)7. Receive Payment (Finance)Now, lets examine each case:Case 1001: Events in order:1. Register Order (SalesRep_01)2. Perform Credit Check (CreditOfficer_1)3. Validate Stock (WarehouseClerk_2)4. Confirm Shipment (LogisticsMgr_1)5. Ship Goods (WarehouseClerk_3)6. Issue Invoice (FinanceTeam_01)7. Receive Payment (FinanceTeam_02)This follows the normal flow exactly.Case 1002:Events:1. Register Order (SalesRep_02)2. Confirm Shipment (LogisticsMgr_2)   -> This is out of order. Expected after Validate Stock, but it occurs before Credit Check and Validate Stock.3. Ship Goods (WarehouseClerk_1)       -> Even more out of order. Expected after Confirm Shipment, but here it is before Credit Check and Validate Stock.4. Perform Credit Check (CreditOfficer_2)5. Validate Stock (WarehouseClerk_2)6. Issue Invoice (FinanceTeam_03)7. Receive Payment (FinanceTeam_02)So, in case 1002, we see that Confirm Shipment and Ship Goods are performed before the Credit Check and Stock Validation. This is an anomaly.Case 1003:Events:1. Register Order (SalesRep_03)2. Perform Credit Check (CreditOfficer_1)3. Ship Goods (WarehouseClerk_3)        -> Out of order. Expected after Validate Stock and Confirm Shipment, but here it is before Validate Stock and Confirm Shipment.4. Issue Invoice (FinanceTeam_01)        -> This is also out of order. Expected after Ship Goods and before Receive Payment, but here it is before Confirm Shipment and after Ship Goods (which is also out of order).5. Confirm Shipment (LogisticsMgr_2)     -> This is late and after Ship Goods and Issue Invoice.6. Receive Payment (FinanceTeam_02)So, in case 1003, we see that Ship Goods and Issue Invoice are performed before Confirm Shipment. Also, note that Validate Stock is missing entirely.Case 1004:Events:1. Register Order (SalesRep_01)2. Receive Payment (FinanceTeam_02)      -> This is very early, before any other steps.3. Issue Invoice (FinanceTeam_01)        -> Invoice issued after payment? Unusual.4. Confirm Shipment (LogisticsMgr_1)     -> After payment and invoice, but note that shipment_scheduled=N in additional_info.5. Ship Goods (WarehouseClerk_4)In case 1004, we see that payment is received before the credit check, stock validation, and even before the invoice is issued. Also, the credit check and stock validation are missing. The Confirm Shipment has shipment_scheduled=N, which might indicate a problem.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, lets hypothesize about the reasons for these anomalies:1. Case 1002 and 1003 show out-of-order activities. This could be due to:- Human error or lack of training: resources performing tasks without following the process.- System issues: maybe the system allows tasks to be performed in any order.- Policy violations: maybe some orders (like priority orders) are allowed to be processed faster, skipping some checks? But note that 1002 is a priority order, but 1003 is standard.2. Missing activities in Case 1003 and 1004. - In 1003, Validate Stock is missing. This could be a data entry error (not logged) or actually skipped.- In 1004, both Credit Check and Validate Stock are missing. This might be because the payment was received early (maybe its a prepaid order from a trusted customer?).3. Early payment in Case 1004. This could be due to:- The order being paid in advance (e.g., cash on delivery? But then payment before shipment?).- A system error in logging the events (maybe the payment was recorded at the wrong time).4. Invoice after payment in Case 1004. This is unusual because typically an invoice is issued and then payment is received. This could be a data entry error or a different payment method (like cash on delivery where the payment is received and then the invoice is issued for record-keeping).5. Confirm Shipment after Ship Goods in Case 1003. This is a violation of the process. It might be that the confirmation was done late or back-dated.6. In Case 1002, Confirm Shipment and Ship Goods are done before Credit Check and Stock Validation. This is a risk because if the credit check fails or stock is not available, then the shipment would have been scheduled and even shipped unnecessarily.7. In Case 1004, the Confirm Shipment has shipment_scheduled=N. This might indicate that the shipment was not scheduled, but then Ship Goods event exists. This could be a data inconsistency or a problem in the process (maybe the shipment was not scheduled but still shipped?).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now, lets propose SQL queries to investigate these anomalies:We have three tables: order_event_log, orders, and resources.Query 1: Check for missing activities in cases.WITH normal_activities AS (    SELECT Register Order AS activity UNION ALL    SELECT Perform Credit Check UNION ALL    SELECT Validate Stock UNION ALL    SELECT Confirm Shipment UNION ALL    SELECT Ship Goods UNION ALL    SELECT Issue Invoice UNION ALL    SELECT Receive Payment),cases AS (    SELECT DISTINCT case_id FROM order_event_log)SELECT     c.case_id,    na.activity AS missing_activityFROM cases cCROSS JOIN normal_activities naLEFT JOIN order_event_log oel     ON c.case_id = oel.case_id AND na.activity = oel.activityWHERE oel.event_id IS NULLORDER BY c.case_id, na.activity;Query 2: Check the order of activities for each case and compare with the expected order.[similar structure for other queries up to Query 9]These queries should help in investigating the anomalies found in the event log.
